input: "Impact of smoking on protein levels of beta-defensins in periodontal disease" :Comparison of gingival crevicular fluid and serum human beta-defensin-2 levels between periodontal health and disease" "Gingival crevicular fluid levels of Interleukin-22 (IL-22) and human β Defensin-2 (hBD-2) in periodontal health and disease : A correlative study" "Serum vitamin D concentration is associated with antimicrobial peptide level in periodontal diseases" "Gingival Crevicular Fluid Levels of Human Beta-defensin 2 and 3 in Healthy and Diseased Sites of Individuals with and without Periodontitis" "Periodontopathogens and human b-defensin-2 expression in gingival crevicular fluid from patients with periodontal disease in Guangxi, China" "Gingival crevicular fluid levels of human beta- defensin-2 and cathelicidin in smoker and non-smoker patients: a cross-sectional study"
output: 1. "Impact of smoking on protein levels of beta-defensins in periodontal disease": This study aims to investigate the effect of smoking on the levels of beta-defensins, which are antimicrobial proteins, in individuals with periodontal disease. 2. "Comparison of gingival crevicular fluid and serum human beta-defensin-2 levels between periodontal health and disease": This research aims to compare the levels of human beta-defensin-2 in gingival crevicular fluid and serum between individuals with periodontal health and those with periodontal disease. 3. "Gingival crevicular fluid levels of Interleukin-22 (IL-22) and human β Defensin-2 (hBD-2) in periodontal health and disease: A correlative study": This study examines the correlation between levels of Interleukin-22 and human beta-defensin-2 in gingival crevicular fluid and their association with periodontal health and disease. 4. "Serum vitamin D concentration is associated with antimicrobial peptide level in periodontal diseases": This research investigates the relationship between serum vitamin D concentration and the levels of antimicrobial peptides in individuals with periodontal diseases. 5. "Gingival Crevicular Fluid Levels of Human Beta-defensin 2 and 3 in Healthy and Diseased Sites of Individuals with and without Periodontitis": This study aims to compare the levels of human beta-defensin 2 and 3 in healthy and diseased sites of individuals with and without periodontitis. 6. "Periodontopathogens and human b-defensin-2 expression in gingival crevicular fluid from patients with periodontal disease in Guangxi, China": This research focuses on examining the presence of periodontopathogens and the expression of human beta-defensin-2 in gingival crevicular fluid from patients with periodontal disease in Guangxi, China. 7. "Gingival crevicular fluid levels of human beta- defensin-2 and cathelicidin in smoker and non-smoker patients: a cross-sectional study": This study aims to compare the levels of human beta-defensin-2 and cathelicidin in the gingival crevicular fluid of smoker and non-smoker patients through a cross-sectional study design.

input: translate the following to arabic : ( Case example ‘It’s an itchy bottom,’ Lucy’s mum says. Lucy Godfrey (4), a bit shy, hides her head in mum’s arm. Her younger brother sits unconcernedly kicking his heels in his little chair. ‘Oh dear’ you say. ‘Can you tell me a bit more?’ ‘Well it’s been going on for a bit’ says her mother Lisa Godfrey. ‘She’s had it for about 2 months, before that she was fine. She’s been itchy during the day but for the last few nights she’s been waking up screaming and I’ve even had to get her up and wash her bottom before she settles. It’s been quite awful actually.’ ‘Is there anything to see?’ you ask. Her mum shakes her head. ‘Just a bit pink around the, you know, back bottom.’ ‘Any pets at home?’ you ask. ‘Or does Lucy suck her thumb or bite her nails at all?’ ‘No pets. But she does suck her fingers at night. She has done since she was small.’ Lucy holds up the first two fingers of her left hand and demonstrates unnecessarily. ‘Because I’m thinking of worms,’ you say. ‘Oh,’ says the mum. ‘Well, there are other things that cause an itchy bottom. In fact, it’s so common it’s got a special name: pruritis ani. Hygiene is the first to mention because sometimes children this age have difficulty wiping their bottoms properly and any poo left behind is a great irritant to the skin and can cause itching.’ You glance at the mum who nods slowly and says ‘Lucy’s not too bad for that.’ You continue, ‘OK. Another common cause is a thrush infection, which can be easily treated with Canesten. There are other conditions related to eczema like something called lichen sclerosis but that’s more common in adults, not really children. But the reason I’m thinking of worms rather than hygiene or eczema is because worms come out of the back passage at night to lay their eggs and that’s when the bottom is itchiest. It fits best with your description of what has been happening with Lucy.’ Lisa Godfrey is nodding. ‘Ok. I had worms once as a child. It was disgusting but I grew up on a farm.’ ‘Because Lucy sucks her fingers it means if she does have a threadworm infection and scratches her bottom she can get the eggs under her nails and then re-ingest them. That’s how people get an infestation of worms. Apparently a lot of us have a threadworm infection quite often but if we don’t re-ingest the eggs it’s just one worm and it eventually dies. It’s very easily treated,’ you add. ‘But you have to treat the whole family, all at the same time. It’s a one-off treatment; a liquid that you swallow.’ ‘Can we test for it?’ Lucy’s mum asks. ‘We can send off a stool sample, and the classic test is to go in at night with a torch and check the child’s bottom to see if there are any worms there.’ Mrs Godfrey grimaces. ‘Or other people put 38 Gastrointestinal Sellotape over the bottom to capture the worm or eggs that way . . . Or we could just swab and then treat. Can I have a look at Lucy’s bottom?’ Lucy is not keen but her mum convinces her to stand on her lap and lowers her pants. Her younger brother wanders around the room ignoring the commotion. You put on some gloves and pause. This examination position is not ideal. ‘Let’s get you over here on my special bed,’ you suggest to Lucy. Her mum carries Lucy over objecting strenuously. ‘If you just lie on your side and tuck your legs up,’ you request. Lucy curls up her legs firmly together. You keep mum at Lucy’s head end cuddling her, and say ‘Now I’m just going to look at your bottom. I’ll be very quick.’ Lucy’s anus is a normal colour, it is clean, there is no surrounding redness or lesions, and no obvious threadworm. Threadworm eggs are too small to see except under a microscope. You take a plain swab (no gel in the base) and moisten it with saline from a saline pod. ‘I’m just going to take the swab,’ you say to Mrs Godfrey and then to Lucy, ‘I’m just going to take a swab with this special cotton wool on a stick. You might feel a tickly feeling on your bottom,’ and quickly but gently wipe the swab around and over the anus to pick up any possible eggs present before Lucy has time to wriggle too much. ‘All done,’ you say. ‘That looks fine, no thrush, nice and clean . . . What shall we do then?’ you ask the mum who is pulling up Lucy’s things. Lucy jumps down and joins her brother. ‘Can you give enough treatment for the four of us?’ asks Mrs Godfrey. You nod and also print off a leaflet and circle the paragraphs about nail cleaning, washing in the morning, and also on hand washing before food preparation and cleaning the bedding. ‘Here’s the prescription. It’s for a liquid called mebendazole. Get everyone to take it tonight and then again in a week’s time.’ Lisa Godfrey is reading the leaflet as you speak and looks up and nods, folding it to look at properly later. ‘Ok, thank you. If we have any other problems we’ll get back in touch.’ One week later you receive confirmation from the laboratory that threadworm ova were present on the swab. )
output: مثال عن الحالة: تقول أم لوسي: "إنها تشعر بحكة في أسفلها". لوسي جودفري (4 سنوات)، خجولة قليلاً، تختبئ برأسها في ذراع أمه. يجلس أخوها الأصغر بشكل لامبالٍ وهو يركل قدميه في كرسيه الصغير. تقول: "أوه، عزيزتي. هل يمكنك أن تخبريني قليلاً؟" تقول والدتها ليزا جودفري: "حسنًا ، استمرت لفترة من الوقت. لقد كانت لديها هذه الحكة منذ حوالي شهرين، قبل ذلك كانت بخير. لقد كانت تشعر بالحكة خلال النهار ولكن خلال الليالي القليلة الماضية كانت تستيقظ صارخة وحتى اضطررت لإيقاظها وغسل مؤخرتها قبل أن تهدأ. لقد كانت فظيعة بصراحة." تسأل: "هل هناك شيء يمكن أن أراه؟" تهز رأسها أمها. "فقط بعض الاحمرار حول، تعرفين، المؤخرة الخلفية." تسأل: "هل لديكم حيوانات أليفة في المنزل؟ أو هل لوسي تمتص إصبعها الإبهام أو تعض أظافرها؟" تجيب: "لا يوجد لدينا حيوانات أليفة، ولكنها تمص أصابعها في الليل. فعلت ذلك منذ صغرها." ترفع لوسي إصبعي يدها اليسرى الأولين وتعرض ذلك بشكل غير ضروري. تقول: "لأنني أفكر في وجود الديدان." تقول الأم: "أوه." تواصل: "حسنًا ، هناك أشياء أخرى تسبب حكة في الشرج. في الواقع ، هو أمر شائع جدًا لدرجة أنه يحمل اسمًا خاصًا: الحكة في الشرج. التنظيف الجيد هو أمر يجب ذكره لأن بعض الأطفال في هذا العمر يواجهون صعوبة في مسح مؤخراتهم بشكل صحيح ويمكن أن يسبب أي براز متبقي تهيجًا كبيرًا للبشرة ويمكن أن يسبب حكة." تلقي نظرة على الأم التي تومئ ببطء وتقول: "لوسي ليست سيئة جدًا في ذلك." تستمر: "حسنًا. سبب آخر شائع هو الإصابة بعدوى فطرية، يمكن علاجها بسهولة باستخدام كانيستين. هناك حالات أخرى مرتبطة بالإكزيما مثل ما يسمى تصلب الحزاز ولكن ذلك أكثر شيوعًا بين البالغين وليس للأطفال حقًا. ولكن السبب الذي يدفعني للتفكير في الديدان بدلاً من النظافة الشخصية أو الإكزيما هو أن الديدان تخرج من الفتحة الخلفية لوضع بيوضها وهذا عندما يكون الشرج لديه أكبر حكة. وهذا يتوافق أفضل مع وصفك لما يحدث مع لوسي." توافق ليزا جودفري رأسها. "حسنًا. لقد كانت لدي ديدان مرة واحدة عندما كنت طفلة. كانت مقرفة ولكن نشأت على مزرعة." تقول: "لأن لوسي تمتص أصابعها، إذا كان لديها عدوى بديدان الأمعاء وتحكّ في مؤخرتها، يمكن أن تحصل على بيوض الديدان تحت أظافرها وتبتلعها مرة أخرى. هذا كيف يحدث انتشار الديدان. على ما يبدو أن الكثير منا يُصاب بعدوى ديدان الأمعاء كثيرًا ولكن إذا لم نبتلع البيوض مرة أخرى ، سيكون هناك ديدان فقط وفي النهاية ستموت. علاجها سهل جدًا،" تضيف "ولكن يجب علاج العائلة بأكملها في نفس الوقت. إنه علاج مرة واحدة ؛ سائل يتم ابتلاعه." تسأل أم لوسي: "هل يمكننا إجراء اختبار لذلك؟" تجيب: "يمكننا إرسال عينة براز والاختبار التقليدي هو الذهاب في الليل بمصباح يدوي وفحص مؤخرة الطفل لمعرفة ما إذا كان هناك أي ديدان هناك." تعبّر السيدة جودفري عن استياءها. "أو يمكن للآخرين أن يضعوا شريطة لاصقة على المؤخرة لالتقاط الديدان أو البيض بهذه الطريقة... أو يمكننا ببساطة أن نأخذ عينة ونعالج. هل يمكنني أن أرى مؤخرة لوسي؟" لوسي ليست حريصة ولكن أمها تقنعها بأن تقف على ركبتيها وتخفض سروالها. يتجول أخوها الأصغر في الغرفة يتجاهل الضجة. تضع قفازات وتتوقف. هذا الموقف الفحص ليس مثاليًا. "لنذهب إلى السرير الخاص بي هنا" ، تقترح لوسي. تحمل أمها لوسي معارضة بشدة. "إذا فقط اضطجعي هنا على جانبك وارفعي ساقيك" ، تطلب. تثني لوسي ساقيها محكمة معًا. تحتفظ أنت بأمها بجوار رأس لوسي وتقول: "الآن سأنظر إلى مؤخرتك. سأكون سريعة جدًا." مؤخرة لوسي ذات لون طبيعي، نظيفة، لا يوجد احمرار حولها أو طفح جلدي ولا وجود واضح لديدان. بيض الديدان صغيرة جدًا لا يمكن رؤيتها إلا تحت الميكروسكوب. تأخذ عينة عادية (بدون جل في القاع) وتبللها بمحلول ملحي من كبسولة محلول ملحي. "سأأخذ العينة فقط" تقول للسيدة جودفري وبعد ذلك للوسي: "سأأخذ عينة بواسطة قطنة خاصة على عصا. قد تشعرين بشعور مقزز على مؤخرتك" ثم تمسح العينة بسرعة ولكن بلطف حول وفوق فتحة الشرج لالتقاط أي بيوض ممكنة قبل أن يتمكن لوسي من التحرك كثيرًا. تقول: "انتهينا. يبدو ذلك على ما يرام، لا يوجد تدرن، نظيف بشكل جيد... ماذا علينا أن نفعل إذن؟" تسأل الأم التي ترفع ملابس لوسي. تنزلق لوسي وتنضم إلى أخيها. تسمح ليزا جودفري بالإيضاح: "هل يمكنك توفير العلاج الكافي لأربعة منا؟" توافق برأسه وتطبع أيضًا نشرة وتحيط بفقرات التنظيف الأظافر، وغسل في الصباح، وكذلك غسل اليدين قبل إعداد الطعام وتنظيف الفراش. "ها هو الوصفة. إنها سائلة تس

output: The text recounts the story of Sarah, a teenager, and her mother battling against anorexia nervosa. input: Write a report of Nkazimulo Zulu's injury Incident Report, include that investigations were done on the footage and also students were asked to say what they know. Date: [25/06/2023] Time: 11:27-11: 54 Location: Bathroom Reporter: Students Let the teachers (Mam Yolanda) know and Mam Lebogang Channe wrote the incident form for the injured learner. Incident Details: On 25/05/2023 Nkazimulo Zulu, a learner in 4C, went to the bathroom with some of his friends during break time. While inside the bathroom, he slipped and fell, resulting in an injury. The incident was first reported to Teacher Yolanda Mouton who was in the building Corridor, who was on duty monitoring the hallway just outside the bathroom. Teacher Yolanda immediately alerted the break duty teachers, Teacher Lebo and Rosa, who referred the learner to the first aiders. After a thorough assessment, the first aiders found that Nkazimulo Zulu had pain on her hand although they could not pick up where the learner had sustained a sprain/fracture. They provided him with immediate first aid assessment, which included asking her to elevate her arm and also applying some minimal pressure on the hand which the learner had pointed as the affected area. Although they could not ascertain the severity of the injury the first aiders advised that Nkazimulo Zulu be taken to the school sick room so that her parents be notified of the incident. Conclusion: In conclusion, Nkazimulo Zulu, a learner in grade 4C got injured during break time, sustaining a hand injury. The incident was reported to teacher Yolanda, who immediately alerted the break duty teachers, Teacher Lebo and Rosa. The first aiders, Mam Nthabiseng and Mr Mhlanga, assessed the child for injuries and provided immediate first aid treatment. Nkazimulo Zulu was advised to be taken to the school sick room for notification of her parents about the incident.
output: Additionally, investigations were conducted on the footage from the bathroom to determine the cause of the injury. However, no evidence indicating foul play was found on the footage. Students who were in the bathroom at the time of the incident were also asked to provide any information they knew about the incident. None of the students indicated that they had seen anything that could have caused the injury. The incident report was submitted to the school's administration for review and to ensure that appropriate measures are taken to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. The school will also provide support to Nkazimulo Zulu and their family as they recover from the injury.

input: To speed up the registration of a Avatrombopag medicinal product in Russia and reduce the time and costs of conducting bioequivalence studies, we offer to conduct an international clinical trial that includes Russia as an additional site for patient recruitment. For this we will need the following from your team: 1. Access to the full clinical trial protocol currently being used in India, so we can align our methodologies and ensure consistency in data collection and analysis. 2. Results and data from the bioequivalence studies conducted with your participants, which will serve as a crucial benchmark for our integrated analysis. Based on the combined data, we will prepare a summary report on the clinical trial for registration in Russia.
output: To expedite the authorization process of the Avatrombopag medicinal product in Russia and to minimize the duration and cost associated with conducting bioequivalence studies, we propose organizing an international clinical trial that incorporates Russia as an additional venue for patient enrollment. For this purpose, we require the following assistance from your team: 1. Provision of the complete clinical trial protocol currently in use in India, allowing us to synchronize our methodologies and guarantee uniformity in data gathering and evaluation. 2. Sharing of the results and data from the bioequivalence studies carried out with your participants, which will be essential for our comprehensive analysis. Utilizing the aggregated data, we will compile a summary report on the clinical trial for the purpose of obtaining registration in Russia.

input: Write a lep plan as a autistic specialist for a 4-year-old autistic boy in Texas
output: I. IDENTIFICATION INFORMATION Student: [Student Name] Birthdate: [Birthdate] Age: 4 years old School: [School Name] Grade: Pre-K Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder Federal Disability Category: Autism State Definition: Autism II. ANNUAL GOALS A. Communication Goals: 1. Increase expressive language a. Combine three to four words into simple to complex sentences (e.g., "I want juice," "I want to play ball") b. Request objects or activities using verbal communication. c. Use words to express personal preferences, desires, and feelings. 2. Improve receptive language a. Demonstrate understanding of simple to moderately complex verbal instructions b. Identify objects, people, and pictures when named by someone else c. Respond to common social greetings and questions when asked by others d. Follow multi-step directions involving a variety of actions and objects B. Social Skills and Emotional Regulation Goals: 1. Enhance social and play skills a. Engage in turn-taking during play activities b. Demonstrate cooperative play with classmates (e.g., sharing toys, taking turns, using partner-assisted strategies) c. Respond to and initiate social interactions with peers and adults (e.g., greetings, conversation starters) 2. Develop emotional regulation strategies a. Identify and express emotions appropriately b. Utilize calming strategies during challenging situations (e.g., deep breathing, counting, using a break card) C. Academic and Cognitive Goals: 1. Develop pre-academic skills a. Recognize and name upper and lowercase letters of the alphabet b. Identify shapes, colors, and numbers up to 20 c. Develop basic fine motor skills (e.g., writing, cutting) III. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES AND SHORT-TERM BENCHMARKS Objectives for each goal will be measured quarterly, with the guidelines provided on the IEP. IV. EVALUATION PROCEDURES Assessment tools for monitoring progress include: 1. ABC (Antecedent-Behavior-Consequence) assessment 2. Performance on teacher-made tests and quizzes 3. Direct observations of social interactions, emotional regulation, and academic skills 4. Informal assessment through anecdotal notes and data collection V. SPECIAL EDUCATION AND RELATED SERVICES A. Autism Specialist: [Specialist Name] 1. Direct support and consultation in the classroom to adapt and modify curriculum, materials, and environment based on the student's needs 2. Provide professional development opportunities to general education teachers, paraprofessionals, and other stakeholders to enhance their understanding of autism and support strategies B. Occupational Therapy: [Therapist Name] 1. Consult and collaborate with teachers and staff to ensure the environmental setup is conducive to the student's sensory needs 2. Provide fine motor and sensory integration support to enhance academic and self-help skills C. Speech and Language Therapy: [Therapist Name] 1. Evaluate and address the student's expressive and receptive language strengths and weaknesses 2. Implement evidence-based strategies and interventions to improve language and communication skills VI. TRANSITION PLAN A. Coordinate financial and/or community-based resources to support the student's transition to kindergarten, including: 1. Identification and contact information for potential resources 2. Establishment and maintenance of communication channels between preschool and kindergarten programs B. Provide opportunities for the student and family to: 1. Visit the kindergarten classroom and teacher 2. Participate in school-related activities with their kindergarten peers 3. Obtain kindergarten readiness materials and resources VII. PARENT PARTICIPATION AND COMMUNICATION A. Parent communication: 1. Annual Review and Individualized Education Program (IEP) meeting 2. Quarterly progress reports regarding the student's progress with communication, social skills, emotional regulation, and academic goals B. Family involvement: 1. Opportunities for home visits 2. Parent-teacher conferences at least twice per year and as needed 3. Educational resources, materials, and suggestions for family activities to support the child's progress at home VIII. REVIEW DATE Date: [Month, Year]

input: 翻译这段文字：Total RNA was isolated from 48 h 10 μmol/L NaCl or KYNA treated HepG2 cells using RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Germany). Paired-end libraries were synthesized by using the TruSeq® RNA Sample Preparation Kit (Illumina, USA) following TruSeq® RNA Sample Preparation Guide. The library was sequenced on the Illumina Novaseq6000 platform (Illumina, USA). Raw data (raw reads) in fastq format were processed using Trimmomatic, and clean reads were mapped to the human genome (GRCh38) using HISAT2 and the read counts of each gene were obtained by HTSeq-count.
output: 使用RNeasy mini kit（Qiagen, Germany）从48小时10μmol/L NaCl或KYNA处理的HepG2细胞中分离出总RNA。使用TruSeq® RNA样品制备套件（Illumina，USA）遵循TruSeq® RNA样品制备指南合成成对末端文库。文库在Illumina Novaseq6000平台（Illumina，USA）上进行测序。使用Trimmomatic处理快速格式的原始数据（原始读数），并使用HISAT2将干净的读数映射到人类基因组（GRCh38），通过HTSeq-count获得每个基因的读数。

input: improve. I’m writing this letter for your attention on miss X, 12 year old girl with recent diagnosis of dilated cardiomyopathy with severly reduce cardiac function. She is currently stable on heart failure medicine. She was previously known to your department with previous AML and treated with anthrocyclines. Her heart failure can be decompensated at anytime specially secondary to respiratory infections and she might attend to your services. Mum is aware about the reg flagged signs and family is happy to have regular follow up in your services as well parerall with our care. I have attached the last clinic letter for your referrence.
output: Subject: Attention: Attention Needed for Miss X - Urgent Medical Follow-up Required Dear [Recipient's Name], I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to bring your attention to the case of Miss X, a 12-year-old girl who has recently been diagnosed with dilated cardiomyopathy, resulting in severely reduced cardiac function. It is imperative that we address her condition promptly to ensure her optimal care and well-being. Currently, she is stable on heart failure medication; however, I wanted to highlight certain aspects of her medical history that demand your immediate attention. Miss X had previously been under the care of your department for acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and was treated with anthracyclines. This treatment may have played a role in her current cardiac complications. Given her diagnosis of dilated cardiomyopathy, it is crucial to remain vigilant as her condition can decompensate at any time, especially in the presence of respiratory infections. In the unfortunate event that her heart failure worsens, she may require your services urgently. I would like to inform you that her mother is fully aware of the red-flag signs and symptoms that may indicate a deteriorating cardiac status. Furthermore, the family is more than willing to have regular follow-ups with your department, in addition to their ongoing care plan with us. For your convenience and reference, I have attached the most recent clinic letter outlining Miss X's medical history. I trust that this information will prove useful in your assessment and will facilitate the necessary steps to ensure her well-being. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require any further information or have any questions regarding Miss X's case. Your immediate attention to this matter is greatly appreciated. Thank you for your anticipated cooperation in providing the best possible care for Miss X. Warm regards, [Your Name] [Your Title] [Your Contact Information]

input: Re-frame and make improvements: Simon introduced the concept of heuristics in the 1950s, suggesting there were limitations to rational decision making. In the 1970s, psychologist Amos Tversky and Daniel Kahneman added to the field with their research on cognitive bias.
output: Simon's introduction of heuristics in the 1950s shed light on the inherent limitations of rational decision making. Building upon his work, psychologists Amos Tversky and Daniel Kahneman expanded the field further in the 1970s by conducting extensive research on cognitive bias.
